title: U.S. Government to Take Cut of Nvidia and AMD A.I. Chip Sales to China
summary: In a highly unusual arrangement with President Trump, the companies are expected to kick 15 percent of what they make in China to the U.S. government.

title: What the Nvidia Chip Payoff Deal Says About Trump’s Trade War
summary: A deal for Nvidia and AMD to give the Trump administration a cut of chip sales to China raises questions about national security and trade policy goals.

title: China’s Automakers Are Taking a Shortcut to European Markets
summary: Ships carrying Chinese cars are using the Red Sea and Suez Canal even as other vessels still sail around Africa in fear of attacks by the Houthi militia.

title: Small Businesses Brace for the Punishing Side Effects of Trump’s Tariffs
summary: Large firms with big bank balances, workers already in jobs and households near the top of the income ladder will have an easier time navigating the economic waves.

title: Trump Prepares to Meet Putin, and Al Jazeera Says Israel Killed Its Journalists in Gaza
summary: Plus, a Labubu heist.

title: A Sidelined Zelensky Warns That Russia Will Try to Deceive the U.S.
summary: Ukraine fears that the Kremlin will try to convince President Trump at U.S.-Russian talks in Alaska that Ukraine, not Russia, is the obstacle to peace.

title: Vance Says U.S. Is Working for a Meeting With Trump, Putin and Zelensky
summary: The vice president said the White House was trying to determine “when these three leaders could sit down and discuss an end to this conflict.”

title: The Harvard-Trained Lawyer Behind Trump’s Fight Against Top Universities
summary: May Mailman is credited as an animating force behind a strategy that has intimidated independent institutions and undercut years of medical and scientific research.

title: This Ohio Farm Community Is a Mecca for the ‘MAHA Mom’
summary: In a neighborhood that appeals to people from both the right and the left, residents strive for a finely tuned state of political harmony.

title: Kennedy’s Next Target: the Federal Vaccine Court
summary: The system for compensating people injured by vaccines needs significant reform. But the health secretary could alter it in ways that ultimately reduce vaccine access for everyone.

title: Israel’s Plan for Gaza City Is Still Unclear
summary: The Israeli government said last week that it wanted to capture Gaza City, but how and when it will proceed has yet to be decided.

title: Israeli Strike Kills 4 Al Jazeera Journalists, Network Says
summary: Anas al-Sharif, a well-known correspondent, was among those killed. Israel said it had targeted Mr. al-Sharif, claiming he worked for Hamas, which he had denied.

title: Australia to Recognize Palestinian Statehood
summary: After similar announcements by France, Britain and Canada, Australia said it would act at the United Nations General Assembly session next month.

title: For Lupita and Junior Nyong’o, ‘Twelfth Night’ Is Child’s Play, Revisited
summary: The siblings “really enjoyed make-believe” as kids. Now they are playing Shakespeare under the stars at the newly reopened Delacorte Theater in Central Park.

title: Why A.I. Should Make Parents Rethink Posting Photos of Their Children Online
summary: Artificial intelligence apps generating fake nudes, amid other privacy concerns, make “sharenting” far riskier than it was just a few years ago.

title: I Never Understood Our Data-Saturated Life Until a Hurricane Shut It Down
summary: When Helene disconnected my part of North Carolina for weeks, my neighbors and I had to relearn old ways of knowing what was happening — and what wasn’t.

title: Will Judges Approve Trump’s Choice for U.S. Attorney in Manhattan?
summary: Jay Clayton, the interim U.S. attorney for the Southern District, was named on an interim basis after Senator Chuck Schumer blocked his nomination.

title: Mamdani Will Visit 5 Boroughs on Anti-Trump Tour
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for mayor, will seek to highlight the ways he believes President Trump’s agenda hurts New York City.

title: Children Were Sexually Abused in New Hampshire State Care. How Much Are They Owed?
summary: New Hampshire is backing away from a promise to pay victims hundreds of millions of dollars. Other states are also rethinking payouts to those harmed under their care.

title: A Haven for English in the Most French of North American Cities
summary: For Quebec City’s tiny English-speaking community, a former jail turned library serves as an essential sanctuary in a metropolis where the domination of French is enshrined in law.

title: Clashing Visions of Syria’s Future Play Out in Ancient Alleys of Damascus
summary: Many in the capital worry that the secular freedoms they enjoyed under the Assad regime are under threat from the new Islamist government.

title: How Short-Term Thinking Is Destroying America
summary: Trump may be able to escape the consequences of his actions; the rest of us cannot.

title: The A.O.C. Deepfake Was Terrible. The Proposed Solution Is Delusional.
summary: Critical thinking is not going to save us.

title: North Korea’s Next Leader?
summary: Kim Jong-un’s daughter, Kim Ju-ae, is perhaps being primed to take control of the regime one day.

title: AOL Will End Its Dial-Up Internet Service (Yes, It’s Still Operating)
summary: The company said the service, synonymous with the early days of the internet, will be discontinued on Sept. 30.

title: Miguel Uribe, Colombian Senator Shot at Campaign Event, Dies at 39
summary: Mr. Uribe, a presidential hopeful, was shot in June at a campaign rally in Bogotá in an attack that shocked the nation.

title: Heavy Rains in Wisconsin Lead to Flooding and Early Closure of State Fair
summary: Record-setting rainfall caused intense flooding in and around the Milwaukee area starting on Saturday night.

title: Terry Reid, Rock Singer Known as ‘Superlungs,’ Dies at 75
summary: He missed his chance to be Led Zeppelin’s lead vocalist, but his solo work — and his otherworldly voice — drew raves from Aretha Franklin and others.
